page.title: 16WILDLIFE OF ILMINGTON AREA
page.content: {Birds}.Most wild birds are found in the district in large numbers.Recent additions are water fowl such as Canada geese, mallards and many varieties of ducks (see p.13{ILMINGTON {LAKES}).Fieldfares and redwings are winter visitors. {Trees}.The most noticeable omission is the elm from which the village was named.Dutch elm disease killed all of them.A recent addition is the maple. {Wildflowers}.All the common flowers are to be found and now cowslips, which were becoming rare, are flourishing again.Before the use of sprays orchids were to be found but they have vanished completely. {Animals}.Most species are flourishing. Otters have now disappeared but a new addition is deer which have escaped from parks and are thriving locally.
